availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Burr Hazell (Green County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace.)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace. Virginia native. Married to Lucy A. Roberson Hazell. Father of Louisa Hazell, William A. Hazell, Mary E. Hazell, Martha J. Hazell, Sintha A. Hazell, Elizabeth M. Hazell, Daniel P. W. Hazell, Eliza J. Hazell, and Bell G. Hazell. Farmer in Green County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned seven enslaved persons in Green County in 1850. Farmer in Green County in 1860. Owned fifteen enslaved persons in Green County in 1860. Justice of the peace in Green County in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 1.

Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994036, Green County Births.
"Burr Hazell (1806-1873)," Find A Grave, Memorial 229525776, accessed March 13, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/229525776.
